verbs.description: ratiocinate (third-person singular simple present ratiocinates, present participle ratiocinating, simple past and past participle ratiocinated)

entries.meaning: To use the powers of the mind logically and methodically; to reason.
examples: "Observe the relative position," returned the Doctor with a smile. "It is your attitude to believe through thick and thin in one man's judgment—your own. I follow the same opinion, but critically and with open eyes. Which is the more irrational—I leave it to yourself."
"Oh, my dear fellow!" cried Casimir, " […]  don't ratiocinate with me."
